tafseer.tafsir: In this verse, Allah swears by the sky which has clusters of stars that are extraordinary in size and countless stars in it. Some are so far away from the earth that their light in normal calculations only reaches us after thousands of years, some even after billions of years. Allah swears by a cluster of stars because it has extraordinary miracles and contains great wisdom and is very useful for humans in their lives. These various miracles and wisdom show us about the greatness of the Creator who is Almighty and Most High in His Knowledge and All-Wise.
In the second verse, Allah swears by the day He promised, namely the Day of Judgment, as well as the day of certainty and retribution. At that time, only God's power and law were in effect.

In the third verse, Allah swears by this universe that can turn attention. In summary, Allah swears by the universe in order to turn people away from thinking about His greatness and majesty, so that they can benefit from what they can see and so that they devote their attention to being able to obtain the nature and secrets of nature that are still hidden.

In these verses it is explained that Allah has destroyed Najran, a city in Yemen, because its inhabitants tortured and killed the followers of Prophet Isa (Christians) who left the religion of the country's rulers, namely Judaism and embraced the religion brought by by Prophet Isa by putting them into the ditches they had dug and given a blazing fire. The heathen of the land sat around the ditches watching the inhuman torture. The torment was actually not what they should have done because these people had no major faults. They torture them simply because the believers believe in Allah, the Mighty, Most Praised, who has the kingdoms of the heavens and the earth and has power over everything in them. There really is no way for the unjust person to escape from His power. For believers, this torment and killing is only a trial and a test that will bring them eternal happiness if they remain patient and have faith in Allah.

At the end of this verse, Allah explains that He has witnessed everything and thus will give the appropriate recompense for the atrocities that have been committed by the disbelievers.

In this verse, Allah explains that for unbelievers who persecute and torture believers and they do not want to leave their religion, remain in disbelief, do not repent before they die, hell fire has been prepared to punish them in the hereafter.

In this verse, Allah explains that those who have faith acknowledge that God is One. Therefore, they do work according to Allah's commands and abstain from all His prohibitions. All that they do to expect His pleasure. In the Hereafter Allah will give them gardens under which streams flow, so that they live happily ever after in Paradise, as a reward for their faith and obedience.

In this verse it is explained that the punishment that will be inflicted on unbelievers who persecute, torture, and kill believers because they do not want to leave their religion, is very severe. It should be remembered that it was Allah who created them, and He also brought them back to life. They will eventually return to Allah. If He has not tormented them in this world, it does not mean that they will not be tormented at all. However, the torment was postponed until they returned to Him, namely on the Day of Resurrection.

In this verse it is explained that Allah is Forgiving to those who return to Him in repentance, Most Gracious to those who truly and sincerely love Him. God also has power that must apply, His commands cannot be refuted, and He does what He wants. If Allah wills destruction for those who are disobedient and disobedient, there is no power that can prevent Him.

In these verses, Allah explained in the form of a question to the Prophet Muhammad that whether it had reached him about the story of Pharaoh and his people who denied the prophethood of Prophet Musa, the story of Pharaoh's arrogance, and the disbelief of his people, and the consequences of their actions, that is, sinking into the sea. Likewise with the Samud people who had denied the Prophet Saleh as a messenger of God. They have slaughtered the camel which is the sign of his prophethood. As a result, Allah sent down His torment upon them by destroying their country and destroying everything that existed. In short, the disbelievers have not changed since ancient times. They always deny the religious truth brought by the prophets sent by God. They will certainly receive a reward like the people before them, if they do not repent and return to the path that pleases Allah.

In this verse, Allah explains that the Al-Qur'an is Allah's noble book, stored in the Lawh Mahfudh. Nothing can match its content and wording, preserved from falsification and alteration. This is in response to the disbelievers who deny the Qur'an by saying that it is the stories of the ancients.
